job_title: Medical Assistant in Marine City, MI

pros: Benefits, wellness, and volunteer time off

job_title: Intake Coordinator in South Bend, IN
pros: HealthLinc is an amazing place to receive patient care. Great clinical as well as Administrative staff! They strive to offer services on all levels. Medical, Dental, Vision, Mental Health, Onsite Pharmacy and Clinical Pharmacists. Navigators are available to assist with Insurance needs such as Medicare, Medicaid, Commercial as well as Private. They also offer a Sliding fee for those who are uninsured and underinsured. HealthLinc educates their employees to understand the meaning of diversity and inclusion awareness. Great place to work!
cons: There are no downsides with this organization.

review_title: Great place to work and grow
pros: HealthLinc cares as much about the employees as they do their patients. With a balanced work and home life, they really care about you being successful in all areas. They offer conferences to help you grow and set goals for personal and professional growth. Co-workers are tons of fun and everyone is on the same page to help the community.
cons: Not enough locations to help the vast amount of patients in need!

job_title: Medical Assistant Supervisor in Michigan City, IN
pros: Help the underserved community and the homeless
cons: HR is to buddy buddy with Managers

job_title: Medical Records Clerk in Valparaiso, IN
cons: not a lot of upward mobility.
Administrative roles: low wages considering the area

pros: Working with medically underserved population has its perks in itself, typically the patients are very appreciative. The employees are pretty down to earth. The company really cares about their employees. I've never met a CEO that cared so much! The benefits aren't bad, when it's so hard to find reasonably priced health insurance these days. They offer employer matched 401k, life insurance, as well as a few other perks. They don't micromanage, and allow you to get your job done. They always seem to be trying to improve the process.
cons: Sometimes forward thinking concepts are hard to get pushed through. There is sometimes a "this is the way it's always been done" barrier that is hard to penetrate.

pros: The work environment, culture including the management and the staff was great. Because it was a clinic the job was very fulfilling and respectable.
cons: The pay could have been better, however I value the job more than the compensation.

Corporate office is managed in very hostile and unprofessional manner. Loyalty to the company is taken for granted as demonstrated by not promoting worthy employees. Morale at Corporate office always low due to CEO's management style. Too many valuable employees have left the company due to harsh treatment.
